Virginia, 1931. The Bondurant brothers are a small family group of traffickers who operate in Virginia alcohol during Prohibition: Jack (Shia LaBeouf), the younger brother, impulsive and ambitious, wants to transform the small family business in operation for large-scale trafficking. He dreams of stylish clothing and powerful weapons, hoping to impress the sublime Bertha (Mia Wasikowska). Howard (Jason Clarke), the middle brother, is the most violent and loyal member of the family. Your common sense dissolves in alcohol regularly can not refuse. Forrest (Tom Hardy), the eldest, is the head of the group and remains determined to protect his family from the new rules imposed by a new economic world. When the fugitive Maggie (Jessica Chastain) arrives in Chicago, he takes her under his protection. Alone against a corrupt police force, an arbitrary justice and rival gangsters, the three brothers write the respective legend: a struggle to remain in their own way, during the first great gold rush of the crime.
